item.title: Merchandise Co-lead (female)
item.description:
Volt Europa has resolved to have all its teams be lead by gender-balanced co-leads, and this is a vacancy for the female position, as the male co-lead is currently filled.

Key Facts

  • Reporting to: Julia Pitterman
  • Working closely with co-lead Angelos Arampatzis
  • Times:  15 hrs per week or more.
  • Location: no particular location is required
  • There is no compensation for this voluntary position
  • Deadline for sending the applications: 12 January 2020

The position

The Merchandise team, as part of the Volt Europa Sustainable Financing team, supports the Volt Europa Treasurer in working towards financial sustainability with the sale of high-quality and creative Volt Europa merchandise. This merchandise produced not only ensures financial growth yet also increases Volt Europa visibility and branding as products are used at campaigns and events.
The Merchandise co-lead is responsible for managing the sale of Volt-branded products and further developing our current platform to ensure national chapters can buy the needed material, while seeking to constantly improve quality and profits.

Tasks and Competencies

> Overseeing key merchandise activities such as sale campaign preparation, ensuring KPIs are met and coordinating with national representatives (80% of time spent)

> Proposing new and creative strategies to resolve product or finance-related issues concerning merchandise (10% of time spent)

> Leading team members and empowering other members in the Sustainable Financing team (10% of time spent)

Requirements

Must have skills:

  • Digital savvy
  • Attention to detail
  • Website development
  • Project management
  • Stakeholder management
  • Creativity, analytical thinking, digital design
  • Collaborative, team orientated approach

Optional: Experience in digital design and merchandise sales. Experience in managing teams.

We offer

Leading the Merchandise team means supporting the leadership to achieve financial sustainability while ensuring we provide our community with needed Volt-branded products. Being part of the Sustainable Financing team will ensure that each individual also gain key knowledge on non-profit management while working with individuals from all over Europe.

Application

Please send an email to julia.pitterman@volteuropa.org with your CV, motivation letter (maximum one page) and a video where you introduce yourself and tell what you would like to achieve in this role.

item.title: Events Co-lead (female)
item.description:
Volt Europa has resolved to have all its teams be lead by gender-balanced co-leads, and this is a vacancy for the female position as the male position is filled.

Key Facts

  • Reporting to: Eileen O’Sullivan & Reinier van Lanschot
  • Working closely with co-lead Michael Vogtmann
  • Hours:  10-20 hrs per week (depending on time of year and events to be planned)
  • Location: no particular location is required

The position

The purpose of the Events co-lead is to have an overview of all European events and actions
Happening. Sharing the capacities needed specifically for larger, long-term events such as the GA and the Volt Festival. Creating a pan-European Team spirit // External: Bringing media attention to Volt; Strengthening the narrative of Volt Europa as a pan-European movement; Providing a stage to present Volt Europa’s policies; Supporting election campaigns, when possible (national, regional, local).

Supervises and coordinates projects. Communicates projects with national Events Leads.

item.title: Data Analytics Co-lead
item.description:
We are looking for a male and a female co-lead.

Key Facts

  • Reporting to: Valerie Sternberg
  • Hours: 10 hrs per week
  • Location: no particular location is required
  • There is no compensation for this voluntary position
  • Deadline for sending the applications: 12 January 2020

The position

The EUR Data Analytics team is at the core of the efforts of Volt being an evidence-based organization. It utilizes the methodological skills of its members to conduct empirical studies, and creates analytical pipelines to enhance the capability of Volt to shape the political discourse in Europe. The Co-Leads of the EUR Data Analytics team will oversee and coordinate the activities of their team.

Key responsibilities & duties

The activities of the EUR Data Analytics team range from such diverse topics as social media analyses over the design of statistical tools for the prediction of Volt’s electoral success to the analyses of Volt’s member-base and Volt’s internal communications. The team coordinates and aligns on these activities with the national D&A teams. The work of the EUR Data Analytics team involves a diverse set of stakeholders from the local level to the European level, as well as cooperating closely with various functional teams (especially comms and tech). 

Our current workstreams are:

  • Internal Data (Analysis of Workplace and the volt.team membership database),
  • Social Media Data (Analysis of our Social Media Activities, Facebook + Instagram)
  • Open Public Data (Election Analysis, Socio-economic data)
  • Survey Team (Creating and distributing surveys to the Volt membership, as well as to external populations)

Tasks and Competencies

  • Coordinates the overall organization and output of the team (10% of time)
  • Aligns on activities and needs with national teams (10% of time spent)
  • Develops new and improves established workstreams together with the team members, (30% of time)
  • Organises and moderates team calls (currently two weekly calls) (10% of time)
  • Acts as a link to key stakeholders such as other functional teams, national boards, or the EUR board (20% of time)
  • Strategises on the development of the team together with the EUR leadership (10% of time)
  • Trains the EUR Data Analytics team (10% of time)

Requirements

Must have:
- Project management, Organizational skills
- Communication skills, fluent English
- Experience in conducting empirical research
- Analytical mindset

Optional: Experience in teaching

Application

Please send an email to valerie.sternberg@volteuropa.org with your CV, motivation letter (maximum one page) and a video where you introduce yourself and tell what you would like to achieve in this role.

item.title: Legal Co-lead

Optional: Basic Excel database skill, Academic qualifications, Qualified lawyer in a Member State, a plus, Work experience and skills, Similar previous experience, Knowledge of French, and other languages, a plus

item.title: General Secretary Co-Lead
item.description:
Key Facts

  • Reporting to: Volt Europa Board 
  • Time required: >25 h/week
  • Location: No fixed location necessary, but Brussels Utrecht or Berlin is practical.
  • There is no compensation for this voluntary position

The position

The key responsibility of the General Secretary is to take ownership of key organisational and administrative activities that ensure Volt Europa can function effectively to create the impact it seeks to create.

Responsibilities

Stakeholder management (Time spent: 50%)

  • The EUR board
  • European functional teams (campaign, support, policy, external relations) 
  • The national boards  
  • National General Secretaries 

and operating as a key contact between the levels above and below as well as prioritizing workloads.

Working closely with the legal team (Time spent: 25%)

  • To ensure that the organization fulfills the legal requirements
  • Working on legal membership structure
  • Manage and approve legal membership in EUR level
  • Working on the structure of the organization and its improvement

Ensuring key processes are in place to professionalise (Time Spent: 25%), such as

  • Implementing new procedures and organizational/administrative systems
  • Managing databases and other IT tools in cooperation with Tech Team & DPO
  • Bringing teams together and kick off key projects and TF
  • Working on documentation as contracts, NDAs, agendas, minutes, draft proposals, emails
  • Working on KM with internal/external experts

We seek the following essential qualifications:

  • Leadership & long term planning skills
  • Project management knowledge
  • Good communication and building-relationship skills
  • Good organisational skills and attention to detail
  • Ability to take responsible decisions
  • Flexibility, organization and time management skills
  • Ability to act immediately on urgent issues and high availability

We welcome the following qualifications:

  • Ability to use IT tools (databases, NB, GD etc.)
  • Ability to be proactive and take initiatives when is needed
  • Ability to exchange best practices in a clear manner
  • EU Law basic knowledge

Application

Please send an email to valerie.sternberg@volteuropa.org and reinier.van.lanschot@volteuropa.org with your CV, motivation letter (maximum one page) and a video where you introduce yourself and tell what you would like to achieve as General Secretary.

item.title: Audit Co-lead
item.description:
Volt Europa has resolved to have all its teams be lead by gender-balanced co-leads, and this is a vacancy for the male and the female position.

Key Facts

  • Reporting to: Julia Pitterman
  • Time required: 15 hrs per week or more.
  • Location: no particular location is required
  • There is no compensation for this voluntary position
  • Deadline for sending the applications: 12 January 2020

The Position

The Audit team, as part of the Volt Europa Sustainable Financing team, provides independent assurance that Volt Europa’s risk management, governance and internal control processes are operating effectively. The team has a double mandate of ensuring Volt Europa AISBL’s is effectively and appropriately operating, whilst also providing support to national chapters in need of professional counsel.

The Audit co-leads deal with issues that are critical to the survival and prosperity of Volt Europa. They go beyond financial risks and statements, to consider wider issues such as reputational risks, growth and processes. They support the Board in making the organization succeed by reporting on how systems and processed designed to keep the organization on track are working.

Tasks and Competencies

> Creating a Volt Europa audit methodology to effectively assess the management of risk and internal controls (60% of time spent)

> Evaluating key documentation (e.g. financial statements) as well as processes in place at the European level to provide fit-for-purpose recommendations (30% of time spent)

> Leading team members and empowering other members in the Sustainable Financing team  (10% of time spent)

Requirements

  • Technical audit skills, knowledge on internal audit standards and codes of practice
  • Effective communication
  • Project management, analytical skills
  • Attention to detail, creativity, analytical thinking, digital design
  • Collaborative, team orientated approach
  • Professional experience (min. 2 years) in audit, preferably internal audit
  • Experience in managing teams (optional)

We offer

Leading the Audit team means supporting the leadership in removing possible risks in different areas, especially financial management. By doing so, the Audit co-leads will gain key knowledge on how Volt Europa is run at all levels and will take part in a unique opportunity to create the foundations for future audit functions – spearheading a critical and strategic apparatus. You will lead innovative and interesting projects while working with individuals from all over Europe that are committed to professionalizing Volt Europa.

Application

Please send an email to julia.pitterman@volteuropa.org with your CV, motivation letter (maximum one page) and a video where you introduce yourself and tell what you would like to achieve in this role.

Leading the Finance team means supporting the leadership to achieve financial sustainability while ensuring that we professionalize on all fronts. The Finance co-lead will also learn key aspects of non-profit management while working with individuals from all over Europe.

item.title: Communications Co-lead (male)
item.description:
Volt Europa has resolved to have all its teams be lead by gender-balanced co-leads, and this is a vacancy for the male position, as the female co-lead position is currently filled.

Key Facts

  • Reporting to: Reinier van Lanschot. Working closely with co-lead Daniela Ramos Giraldo. As well as the co-leads of the comms subteams and the accountable board members of those subteams
  • Hours: >12 hrs per week
  • Location: no particular location is required
  • There is no compensation for this voluntary position
  • Time limit for sending the applications: 12 January 2020

Purpose of the position

The Communications team of Volt Europa is in charge of the Communications strategy, as well as the production of the external communications
of the party’s European level. The Comms Co-leads are in charge of coordinating the work of the team with regards to the party’s Social Media presence, graphics design and PR word and strengthening Volt’s brand, narrative and media presence whilst also coordinating messaging and content with national Communications teams. 

Key responsibilities & duties

The Co-Leads will coordinate the Strategy, Design, PR and Social Media sub-teams to ensure overall communicative cohesion. The leads also coordinate with the national communications teams to ensure alignment between the different national chapters of Volt Europa. The co-leads also work on the overall strategic communications of Volt. 

The leads also support in content creation, such as for example, but not limited to, drafting of press releases and social media statements on various social media platforms, and graphic design. 

Tasks and Competencies

> Liaise with National Teams (40% of time spent)

> European Team Leadership (40% of time spent)

> Content creation (20-50% (to decrease as team capacity is built))

Requirements

Must have:

- Leadership and management skills
- Communication skills (messaging, framing and spinning)
- Time managing skills
- Multitasking capacity
- Good organisational skills
- Attention to detail
- Team orientated approach

Optional:

Project management experience, Conflict resolution experience, writing skills, graphic design, Qualifications relating to communications and public relations is meriting. Experience working in the field of professional communications and communication within Volt is meriting.

Application
